plugin.name: GenBank Submission
plugin.description: Geneious now supports uploading your sequences directly to GenBank. Simplify the process of submitting sequences, genomes, features, primers, traces, and more!

version.changes: - Improved user interface - Improved support for annotation types (e.g. support for RNA Editing) - Improved pre-submission error checking

- Fixed bug causing submission to set molecule type to be "Genomic DNA" when choosing "Genomic RNA", "Ribosomal RNA" or " Transfer RNA" - GenBank submission now attempts to replace non-ascii character with equivalent ascii characters before submission - Will now submit existing LIMS sequences from reference assemblies generated by the Biocode LIMS plugin instead of generating new consensus sequences - Now correctly warns that alignments built from sequence lists are unsupported - Now warns if trying to submit a contig with too many reads - Remove "Split into separate sequences around '?' calls" consensus option to prevent crashes that occured when using it - Improved help button in GenBank Submission options for mac. - Now correctly allows non-mitochondrial genetic location when genetic code is set to "Candidate Division SR1 and Gracilibacteria Code" (translation table 25) - Updated for the NCBI's transition to HTTPS (http://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/news/06-10-2016-ncbi-https)

- Substitute any disallowed characters in the Submission Name with hyphens to prevent submission failure - Better error message if submission contains non-ASCII characters - Bundle Guava v30 library (previously depended upon Guava v25 from PrivateAPI)

plugin.name: MrBayes
plugin.description: Runs the well known program MrBayes (included) for Bayesian estimation of phylogeny. Includes interactive display of posterior output. MrBayes is a standalone application and can also be run independently of Geneious. It is released under the GNU General Public License, and its source code is freely available.

version.changes: - Compatibility with Geneious 5.1.1 and later
- Compatibility and stability improvements
- Improved memory efficiency - Forwards compatibility with Geneious 6.0 - Stopped MrBayes crashing when data has duplicate names

- Updated bundled binary to 3.2.1 - Added help for enabling CUDA/Beagle with custom binaries - Fix plugin not importing consensus tree produced by MrBayes - Properly display non-string attribute values produced by new MrBayes consensus tree - Better tip attributes for MrBayes consensus tree - Two MrBayes document types that had same name crashed workflows - make one type - Cancelling the operation in Geneious did not quit the running MrBayes process on Mac and Linux

- Fixed bug where MrBayes wouldn't run if there were Chinese characters in the path to the data directory - Improved NEXUS export performance for very long sequences - Added an option to skip importing raw trees to improve performance in cases where Geneious runs out of memory after running MrBayes

plugin.name: EMBOSS Tools
plugin.description: Run several EMBOSS programs (included) from within Geneious including back translate, mutate, shuffle, garnier secondary structure prediction and more. EMBOSS is a freely available software package for molecular biology.

version.changes: Fixed a bug that caused the charge graph to be drawn upside-down
Fixed a bug that caused the charge graph to be drawn upside-down
Added fuzznuc and fuzzpro

Changes made to "Search for Motif with Mismatches" (fuzznuc and fuzzpro) - Added options for annotation type and name - Added the ability to search selected documents for all primers and probes - Fixed various bugs that could occur when searching over multiple documents Other changes - Completed support for operations on sequence list documents

plugin.name: Mutate and Shuffle
plugin.description: Automatically mutate or shuffle sequences

version.changes: Released as external plugin

plugin.name: EMBOSS Protein Analysis
plugin.description: Predict secondary structure, antigenic regions and signal cleavage sites

version.changes: Released as external plugin
Fix occasional crash in sigcleave when the sequence starts with 'ID'

plugin.name: EMBOSS Nucleotide Analysis
plugin.description: Predict transcription factors and protein coding regions

version.changes: - Fixed crash and/or incorrect results from protein prediction graph on sequences containing ? characters - Fixed failure to draw graph after choosing invalid options and then changing the options to be valid again - Fixed out of memory error with long error messages

plugin.name: Mauve Genome Alignment
plugin.description: Construct and visualize multiple genome alignments in the presence of large-scale evolutionary events such as rearrangement and inversion. Based on the freely available program Mauve.

version.changes: Upgraded Mauve to version 2.1.1
- Improved support for importing xmfa files - Fixed crash when clicking on Alignment
- Added support for sequence lists - Better progress indication - Compatible with Geneious 4.8
Supports annotation tracks

- Fixed a problem where import fails on valid XMFA file when there is no space in front of sequence number - Fixed the importer producing nameless documents - Made the operation failed dialogues more friendly - Fixed a problem that caused alignments extracted from features in the genome alignment viewer to be offset by 1 - Fixed a problem where question mark nucleotides were being deleted by Mauve and causing annotations to be offset - Now mentions when no alignment could be produced

- Fixed DCJ analysis in most cases - Added an option to save contigs in order as a sequence list or concatenated sequence when running MCM - Mauve alignment exporter now exports referenced source genomes in Genbank flat format (better supported by current versions of Mauve) - Mauve .backbone file is now saved; when exporting Mauve alignments in .xmfa format the .backbone file will also be exported if it is available

- Fixed a bug loading of annotations and contig boundaries for sequence lists missing accession numbers on contained sequences - Updated some icons to be high res and fit the new UI. - Tweak wording of "Show Details" in exception dialog - Bundle Guava v30 library (previously depended upon Guava v25 from PrivateAPI) - Prevent creating or viewing invalid alignments

plugin.name: PAUP*
plugin.description: Run PAUP* phylogenetic inference from inside Geneious. You will need a licensed copy of PAUP*, or an active alpha-test release to use this plugin. Includes Modeltest. Modeltest is covered by the GPL. Download the Modeltest source.

version.changes: - Added a workaround for bug running modeltest with model scores from PAUP* alpha releases where parameter values were interpretted incorrectly

Bug Fixes - NJ ignoring specified model. - Block panel not initialising with correct options - Block panel not adding right lines when doing NJ modeltest. - Crash when sequence has empty name - Sets model after writing distance matrix to file for NJ and ML trees
- Further changes to prevent the plugin freezing on large output
- Improved performance by not saving unnecessary log output - Fixed a crash in the plugin when running in Geneious 5.3
- Made all tree search trees editable - Fixed to work with paths with spaces in them on MacOS - Don't insist all lines end with a semicolon
-Fix modeltest failure for users with long path to temp directory
- Model chosen when using Modeltest and score of best tree given as notes - Fix bug where Modeltest sometimes ran when doing Maximum Parsimony

plugin.name: PhyML
plugin.description: Maximum Likelihood tree building for alignments. Please cite Guindon S. & Gascuel O. (2003) Syst. Biol. 52:696-704. when using PHYML.

version.changes: Fixed crash caused by progress reporting
- Added custom substitution model option, can be used with ModelTest output - Added optimization option (Topology/Length/Rate)

- Fixed crash on Windows when running from a data directory containing certain non-Latin characters (e.g., Chinese) - Fixed crash that would occur when running with a custom substitution model on Windows machines
- Updated included PhyML to version 3.3.20180621 - Show PhyML version number in the options dialog

plugin.name: Transmembrane Prediction
plugin.description: Predicts transmembrane spanning regions of proteins using TMHMM (Transmembrane Hidden Markov model). Reference: Best alpha-helical transmembrane protein topology predictions are achieved using hidden Markov models and evolutionary information; Håkan Viklund and Arne Elofsson; Protein Science Vol. Protein Sci. 2004 Jul;13(7):1908-17.

version.changes: - More informative annotations
Replace Windows binaries with newly-built copies that can output posterior probabilities
Fixes crash when sequence name is empty.

plugin.name: Heterozygotes
plugin.description: Identifies heterozygotes in sequences with trace information by looking at the relative height of traces at peak positions.

version.changes: - Now works on alignments and contigs

- Allow configuration of options when running from workflow - Fixed false positives - Fixed false negatives - Added new setting ("Peak Detection Height") for finer grained tweaking of heterozygote detection - Added new setting ("Minimum confidence to call heterozygote") to prevent heterozygote detection in low quality regions - Renamed "Minimum Confidence Score" to "Flag all positions with confidence below" to better reflect what that setting does. - Added setting "Identify incorrect base calls when alternative peak height is" to detect clearly wrong base call

plugin.name: Coiled Coils
plugin.description: A protein sequence graph for predicting coiled-coil regions based on "Predicting coiled-coil regions in proteins", Andrei Lupas. Curr Opin Struct Biol. 1997 Jun;7(3):388-93.

version.changes: - Now gives identical results to coils2 - Fix issue with sequences with fewer than 28 residues

plugin.name: CpG Islands
plugin.description: A nucleotide sequence graph for predicting CpG Islands based on the model and parameterisation described by Richard Durbin, Sean Eddy et al. (1999) in Biological Sequence Analysis: Probabilistic Models of Proteins and Nucleic Acids.

version.changes: - Improved graph drawing on circular sequences in Geneious 4.0+

plugin.name: Complement Or Reverse Only
plugin.description: Provides menu items to 'Complement Only' or 'Reverse Only' a sequence.

version.changes: Fixed Bug to make it compatible with Geneious 8

plugin.name: Batch Rename
plugin.description: Permanently rename sets of documents using the values from another column such as Organism

plugin.name: DualBrothers Recombination Detection
plugin.description: Detect recombination and spatial phylogenetic variation using DualBrothers.

version.changes: Improved stability
- Fixed crash when input trees provided - Fixed crash if two sequences have the same name - Fixed crash if a sequence name has a trailing space

plugin.name: Phobos Tandem Repeat Finder
plugin.description: Finds tandem repeats in DNA sequences using Phobos 3.3.10.
plugin.authors: Biomatters Ltd and Dr Christoph Mayer

version.changes: Fixed a bug that caused an imperfect search to be performed when extend exact search was selected
Appears in "Annotate and Predict" menu

plugin.name: PDB Structure Aligner
plugin.description: Aligns two PDB structures using BioJava structure alignment.

version.changes: Fixed an issue with multi-model structures

plugin.name: Species Delimitation
plugin.description: Explore species properties on a phylogenetic tree, including the chance probability of distinctive clades and the reliability of species identification.
plugin.authors: Brad Masters (major developer) and Howard Ross (modifications)

upOnlyVersion.changes: Fixed typo that led to crashes if an error occurred during results table creation

plugin.name: MAFFT multiple aligner
plugin.description: Align sequences using the program MAFFT which features several methods for extremely fast and accurate alignment.

version.changes: - 64-bit support on Windows - Further compatibility fixes on Windows
- Updated binary to 7.017
- Handle network file paths on Windows - Add option to automatically determine sequences' direction - Fix error in Windows 64 version handling of spaces in data directory path
- Handle out of memory error gracefully instead of with crash - Update binary to 7.308/7.309
- Update MAFFT to 7.450 (7.429 for Window 32-bit) - fixes issues running MAFFT on Windows when paths contain non-Latin-1 characters - Add support for using multiple threads (--thread -1)
- Update MAFFT to 7.490 - Removed support for MAFFT under win32

plugin.name: InterProScan
plugin.description: Search InterPro, an integrated database of protein signatures

version.changes: - Fixed InterProScan by using a new REST API
- Fixed InterProScan by using a new REST API

plugin.name: Glimmer Gene Prediction
plugin.description: Predict genes using Glimmer3. Glimmer is a system for finding genes in microbial DNA, especially the genomes of bacteria, archaea, and viruses.

version.changes: Improved error handling to track down issues with Glimmer on certain data
-Improved memory efficiency -Fixed parse error

- Fixed the plugin so it will work on Windows - Made it fail gracefully on training annotations that Glimmer is unable to process - Fixed cryptic failure messages on some sequences - Fixed a crash when the Glimmer model output contains an empty line

plugin.name: Microsatellite Plugin
plugin.description: Import ABI .fsa files, automatically call peaks and fit ladders, bin data into alleles and export for further analysis.

version.changes: - Added more ladders - Ladders are now stored in an editable text file
- Fix some crashes in bin guessing - Fix resource leak (threads not terminated) - Fix occasional crash in notification slider animation

- Fix a crash due to rounding error that could happen when a bin midpoint is exactly at a ladder peak - Fix a crash when loading FSA files with more than 5 traces - Fix quirky scrolling behaviour with Apple magic mouse or trackpad - Bundle Guava v30 library (previously depended upon Guava v25 from PrivateAPI)

plugin.name: Cap3
plugin.description: Performs contig assembly using CAP3 (http://seq.cs.iastate.edu)

plugin.name: Polymorphic SSRs
plugin.description: Find polymorphic tandem repeats in an alignment using Phobos

plugin.name: RAxML
plugin.description: RAxML (Randomized Axelerated Maximum Likelihood) is a program for sequential and parallel Maximum Likelihood based inference of large phylogenetic trees.

version.changes: - Added link to RAxML website - Added citation information for RAxML

plugin.name: FastTree
plugin.description: FastTree infers approximately-maximum-likelihood phylogenetic trees from alignments of nucleotide or protein sequences. FastTree can handle alignments with up to a million of sequences in a reasonable amount of time and memory.

plugin.name: FreeBayes Variant Finder
plugin.description: Find variants using FreeBayes

version.changes: - Upgraded FreeBayes to version 1.1

plugin.name: Bowtie
plugin.description: Bowtie is an ultrafast and memory-efficient tool for aligning sequencing reads to long reference sequences. The plugin includes both Bowtie2 and Bowtie. Only 64 bit operating systems are supported. Bowtie2 is released under the GNU General Public License v3, and its source code is freely available.

version.changes: - Removed the debug executables for Windows which were required for Bowtie2 2.2.6 - Upgraded Bowtie2 to 2.3.0 on Windows, 2.3.2 on Linux and MacOS
- Improved Bowtie command line parameters help - Upgraded Bowtie2 to 2.4.5

plugin.name: LASTZ
plugin.description: LASTZ is a BLAST-like alignment tool for the pairwise alignment of chromosome-sized nucleotide sequences. It results in a modified Sequence Document viewer showing a dotplot graph above the target sequence. Many query sequences can be aligned against a single target, allowing researchers to find the distribution of their sequence of interest in the query sequences/genome.

version.changes: - Fixed occasional crash in progress dialog trying to display a warning
- Updated LastZ to version 1.04.15

plugin.name: Velvet
plugin.description: Performs contig assembly using Velvet. See http://www.ebi.ac.uk/~zerbino/velvet/.

version.changes: - Upgrade to Velvet 1.2.10 - Implement on desktop Geneious on all 64-bit platforms
Fixed crash when there are 0 length reads and all other reads are shorter than 46

plugin.name: MIRA
plugin.description: Multi-pass DNA sequence assembler for whole genome and EST/RNASeq.

version.changes: - Release open source version of plugin - Nicer failure message when trying to run MIRA on sequences without quality - Make compatible with Geneious 10.1 and newer
Fixes incompatible locale settings preventing MIRA from running on Ubuntu out of the box.

plugin.name: Classify Sequences
plugin.description: Classifies one or more sequences by comparing to a known database

version.changes: Updated author to include Aaron Kennedy (USDA-APHIS-PPQ)
- Updated for compatibility only with versions of Geneious Prime 2019.0 and later

plugin.name: Barcode Validator
plugin.description: Runs batch validation on sets of traces and barcode sequences against user specified parameters.

upOnlyVersion.changes: - Exposed options for the MUSCLE alignment that occurs during PCI calculation - Made the report more compatible between versions of Geneious

plugin.name: Biocode Plugin
plugin.description: The Biocode LIMS is a Geneious plugin that was developed as part of the Moorea Biocode Project. It comprises everything you need to manage your lab and sequence analysis workflows.

upOnlyVersion.changes:
3.0.7
- Set default geome fims instance to production
- Enable either production or develop geome to be called
- Bug fixes

3.0.6
- Enable queries on GeOMe project (in the drop-down list of search terms)
- Cache FIMS data when performing tissueID search in GeOMe. Eliminates need to redo the search
- Specify a single query for all available projects rather than looping projects for GeOMe
- Populate attributes using a call to GeOMe network API instead of individual projects which speeds up populating attributes.
- Enable full-text queries for GeOMe projects.

plugin.name: FLASH
plugin.description: FLASH (Fast Length Adjustment of SHort reads) is a very fast and accurate software tool to merge paired-end reads from next-generation sequencing experiments. FLASH is designed to merge pairs of reads when the original DNA fragments are shorter than twice the length of reads. The resulting longer reads can significantly improve genome assemblies. They can also improve transcriptome assembly when FLASH is used to merge RNA-seq data.

upOnlyVersion.changes: - Exposed more options - Added custom command line - Improved descriptions

plugin.name: BBDuk Trimmer
plugin.description: Adapter/Quality Trimming and Filtering using BBDuk from BBTools by Brian Bushnell. As of Geneious Prime 2023 this plugin is no longer required to access the BBDuk functionality.

plugin.name: BBMap
plugin.description: BBMap short read aligner from BBTools by Brian Bushnell

plugin.name: Repeat Finder
plugin.description: Identifies regions in one or more sequences that are repeated elsewhere in the sequences.

version.changes: - Updated for compatibility only with versions of Geneious Prime 2019.0 and later

plugin.name: Augustus
plugin.description: Augustus is a gene prediction program for eukaryotes written by Mario Stanke and Oliver Keller. It can be used as an ab initio program, which means it bases its prediction purely on the sequence. This plugin allows you to choose an organism then run Augustus and save the results as annotations on your sequence.

upOnlyVersion.changes: - Augustus can now be configured from workflows

plugin.name: Minimap2
plugin.description: A versatile mapper / pairwise aligner for genomic and spliced nucleotide sequences

version.changes: Updates minimap2 to version 2.24.

plugin.name: Flye
plugin.description: A de novo assembler for single molecule sequencing reads, such as those produced by PacBio and Oxford Nanopore Technologies

version.changes: Fixes crash with python 3.8 on Mac.
